features: EASY TO DIGEST: Similac infant formulas are nutritionally complete and inspired by breast milk
SUPPORTS BRAIN & EYES: Has DHA and lutein, important ingredients found in breast milk
NO PALM OLEIN OIL: Designed to support excellent calcium absorption
NO ARTIFICIAL GROWTH HORMONES: Similac was the first leading infant formula brand with no artificial growth hormones. It’s also kosher and halal
PREFERRED BRAND: Similac is the infant formula brand fed in hospitals
body.description: Similac Advance* is a nutritionally complete, milk-based, iron-fortified infant formula for baby’s first year. It has our exclusive blend of ingredients to support baby’s brain and eye development. Our no palm olein oil blend supports excellent calcium absorption. Similac was the first leading infant formula brand with no artificial growth hormones† and is the #1 infant formula brand fed in hospitals. * Not for infants or children with galactosemia. † No significant difference has been shown between milk derived from rbST-treated and non-rbST-treated cows.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Supports Brain & Eye Development Similac Advance has our exclusive blend of DHA for brain nourishment, lutein for eye health, and vitamin E for growth and development—all important nutrients naturally found in breast milk. No Palm Olein Oil Formulas with no palm olein oil have been shown to promote softer stools for your baby, more like breastfed infants. And our no palm olein oil fat blend supports excellent calcium absorption. Feeding Resources No matter how you choose to feed your baby, Similac is here to support your journey. MySimilac Rewards With MySimilac Rewards, get nutrition guidance for you and baby, exclusive benefits, coupons, and much more.

Similac Advance Similac Pro-Advance Similac Sensitive Similac 360 Total Care Complete Nutrition for Infan ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Has DHA, Lutein, and Vitamin E ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Non-GMO† († Ingredients not genetically engineered.) ✓ ✓ Our Closest Formula to Breast Milk ✓ For Fussiness & Gas Due to Lactose Sensitivity ✓ 5-HMO Prebiotic Blend including 2'-FL HMO ✓ Not for infants or children with galactosemia. ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good for baby
reviews.reviewText: Our 2 month old baby girl did very well on this formula. The pre-made formula made it easy to prepare bottles ahead of time refrigerate and warm to feed. Definitely will be purchasing more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars None are expired
reviews.reviewText: I was worried to receive something expired or almost expired but the range of expiration was at least 7-10 months away. All my kids used this specific formula and it works for us.

reviews.reviewerName: 很好，就是小一点 适合人少使用
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The baby has finished drinking and bought back several times.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2012
reviews.reviewText: I was using the RTF bottles to go for supplementing breastfeeding on the go and for night feedings.After returning to work, this is more economical. My son drinks 5 ounces every 3.5-4 hours. I pour these so his caregiver is able to feed him when I'm at work. This usually comes to 2 feedings during the day. I try to feed him before I leave. Occasionally, I'll leave a 2 ounce bottle just in case he needs more than I breastfed him for the next four hour span.Similac Feeding Guidelines are on their website, but I've copy and pasted them below:Birth-1 week: 6-10 feedings per day (approx every 2.5 - 4h); 2-3 fl oz per feeding1 week-1 month: 7-8 feedings per day (approx every 3 - 3.5h); 2-4 fl oz per feeding1-3 months: 5-6 feedings per day (approx every 4 - 4.5h) ; 4-5 fl oz per feeding3-6 months: 4-5 feedings per day (approx every 4.5 - 6h); 6-7 fl oz per feeding6-9 months: 3-4 feedings per day (approx every 6 - 8h) ; 7-8 fl oz per feeding9-12 months: 3 feedings per day (approx every 8h); 7-8 fl-oz per feedingEvery baby is different. My son is currently 10 weeks old. He should be eating every 4 hours. He's usually screaming at me by 3.5h (not at all ready for 4.5 hour stretches). So I feed him every 3.5 hours (sometimes even every 3 hours). He's healthy and happy. He used to wake up multiple times during the night for more feedings. He now sleeps through the majority of the night. If he wakes up, I breastfeed him at night. If he's still upset, I supplement with about 2 ounces.In looking at their recommended feedings, I can't imagine my son eating every 8 hours, because I eat more frequently. At a minimum, I eat every four hours during the day. After dinner, I don't eat again until the morning. This is the only potential 8 hour stretch I'm seeing... but who knows! My doctor says we should start discussing the addition of foods to my sons diet on his next visit. He'll be 3 months by then.In regards to his poop... Diapers look the same as they did when I was breastfeeding. When speaking with Similac about "shipping temperatures" .. they mentioned that their carrier was aware of proper temperatures to ship their product, which could cause delays in shipping during extreme temperatures. I'm not sure if Amazon does this. But... I can say, Amazon has never let my baby go hungry. This is the fastest shipping item on Amazon. I have never had to go elsewhere to buy overpriced Similac.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This became super helpful in the first month of my sons life. Especially during those late night feedings when mixing the water and powdered formula turned into spilled powder and incorrect amounts.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best milk for babies!
reviews.reviewText: I like everything about this product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Buy Missing QR Code
reviews.reviewText: So I’ve been purchasing Similac Advance or 360 since my daughter was born via Amazon. I found it was a better deal and I was still able to utilize Similac Rewards. However, the last three months I’ve noticed none of the bottles come with the QR code anymore. Since I ordered two cases each order every two weeks I was able to get 25.00-30.00 off. Because the QR codes are no longer available this deal is no longer beneficial and I will ship via Similac.😔
